item.ptxt: Confirm the sheet thickness, tensile strength, and existence of the zinc treatment of both sides, and set the welder to conform to the welding conditions by referring to Front Body Construction, Roof and Side Panel Construction, and Floor and Rear Body Construction.
Welding symbols (The welding symbols with dashed lines have a meaning of the spot welding of the part which is not visible)

s1.ptxt: Because the adhesive between the outer panel (A) and the rear inner panel (B) may burn when welding the outer panel, scrape out the sealer (C) between the outer panel and the rear inner panel with a pick tool (D).

item.ptxt: Grind the wheel arch portion of the rear inner panel (A), the side sill rear end plate (B), and the outer panel repair part (C) with a belt sander using sand paper.
Air blow the grinding surfaces, then degrease with a wax and grease remover.

s1.ptxt: Put the cartrige in a caulking gun, and run a continuous bead of the adhesive (A) on the rear inner panel (B), the side sill rear end plate (C), and the outer panel repair part (D).
NOTE: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Adhesive: 3M AUTO MIX Panel Bonding , or equivalent, commercially available
NOTE: See the adhesive manufacturer's instructions for details.
Even out the applied adhesive (A) with a spatula (B).

item.ptxt: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Be careful not to entrap air in adhesive.

s1.ptxt: Body side: Reapply the adhesive (A) on the rear inner panel (B) and the side sill rear end plate (C).
NOTE: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Install the new front pillar outer separator on the front pillar lower stiffener complete.Apply the sealer without gaps all the way around the separator and inside the outer panel repair part.
Make a gap evenly with the rear inner panel (A) mm ( in) while pushing the wheel arch portion of the outer panel repair part (B).
NOTE: Use a commercially available adhesive remover to remove any excess adhesive.
Do the main welding. Weld the outer panel repair part (A).

()*: Welding positions with the side sill stiffener (B), high-strength steel ( MPa) parts. Perform the spot welding on the conditions of No. in the table shown below. Confirm the MIG brazing conditions.
Apply the sealer (A) to the gap between the outer panel (B) and the rear inner panel (C) beside the butt welding area of the rear wheel arch.
NOTE: Do not move the body until the adhesive is dry.
